questions.question_text:
A project development team is located in different areas around the world. Last week, a very important release was delayed because one of the developers did not respond on time to an email that was sent to everyone. The developer seems to have missed reading the email.
What should the project manager do to avoid these situations?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Review the communications management plan

Selected Answer: D
D. Review the communications management plan

Selected Answer: D
Comm plan focuses on how the communications should be managed. In this scenario, the developer was supposed to respond. The responsibilities of the team members when it comes to the project communications are captured in the comm plan.
Correct answer is "D". The project manager need to ensure the message is received,understood and acknowledged by the receiver. Just pushing the message won't help.

comments.content: The developer didn’t see the email. It does not mean that they didn’t want to read the email. The communication plan should include multiple ways to reach or get the attention of stakeholders, especially at important times like that one. The communication plan would need a revision.

discussion.content: If the developer has missed reading an e-mail, then stakeholder engagement must be reviewed, e-mail was sent to everyone, so it seams there is no requirement of reviewing communication management plan, So my answer is A.

questions.question_text:
During a sprint, one of the team members found an issue. According to the team member and the product owner, the issue has a higher level of importance than the other features of the sprint, but is not a roadblock to completing it.
What should the project lead ask the project team do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The project lead should D. Follow the sprint plan by delivering the features established for the sprint and prioritize the issue in the backlog. In Agile methodologies, once a sprint has started, its scope is generally fixed. New issues discovered during the sprint should be added to the product backlog and prioritized for future sprints. This helps maintain the team’s focus and productivity, and ensures that issues are addressed in a structured and efficient manner

Selected Answer: D
D. Follow the sprint plan by delivering the features established for the sprint and prioritize the issue in the backlog.

In the Scrum framework, it's generally recommended to stick to the sprint plan and prioritize the issue separately in the product backlog. The Scrum Team should maintain the sprint focus and commitment to delivering the planned sprint backlog items. Any new issues or changes identified during the sprint should be addressed in the product backlog and prioritized accordingly. This allows for better planning and ensures that the team completes the committed sprint scope while also addressing important issues in an organized manner during subsequent sprints.

Selected Answer: D
D. Follow the sprint plan by delivering the features established for the sprint and prioritize the issue in the backlog
I would go with D. CCB for a scrum project not so sure

It helps set the context and boundaries of the project, which can be crucial in addressing the customer's concern.

After consulting the Scope Management Plan, the project manager may then consider referring to the Requirements Traceability Matrix and performing an analysis to further investigate the specific requirement and its status. However, starting with the Scope Management Plan is a logical and essential first step in understanding the situation and managing customer expectations.

A project's customer is furious. When the customer arrived at the project site, they discovered that one of their requirements was not met.
What should the project manager do?

choices.B: Ask the client for a meeting and explain that the task will not be performed.
choices.C: Evaluate the consequences and meet with the client to explain the possible scenarios.
choices.A: Try to accomplish the task internally by leveling resources from other projects.
choices.D: Hire the resource in order to achieve the project objectives.

The project team is experiencing schedule delays due to issues arising with suppliers. Some of the tasks are on the critical path.
What should the project manager do in this situation?

choices.A: Discuss the critical path issues with the purchasing department.
choices.D: Escalate the supplier-related issues to the sponsor for resolution.
choices.B: Review the critical path with the stakeholders to define next steps.
choices.C: Review the work breakdown structure (WBS) with the suppliers.
